intro: Thoracostachyum lucbanense, commonly known as the Lucban grass, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It is typically found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
